entry.title: Westminster Underground Station
entry.content:
Westminster station is located in central London, on the north bank of the Thames River [1].

Westminster underground station is one of the main film locations for "Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix" [2].

Creators: Arpingstone
Licence: Public Domain
Source Link: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Westminster.tube.station.jubilee.arp.jpg

Harry Potter and Mr. Weasley passed through Westminster underground station when they were on their way to the Ministry of Magic for interrogation. Mr. Weasley was excited to see the "Muggle" turnstile gate in the station, although he met problems using his ticket at the turnstile gate.

The station is located next to London's wonderful sites such as the Big Ben, Houses of Parliament and Downing Street.

Address: London, SW1A 2JR, UK
entry.summary: Westminster station is located in central London, on the north bank of the Thames River.

entry.title: Australia House
entry.content:
Australia House, namely, the Australian High Commission in London, is the diplomatic arm of Australia in the United Kingdom, located close to the strand campus of King's College London [1].

Creator: Martin Addison
Licence: CC BY-SA 2.0
Source Link: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Australia_House_-_geograph.org.uk_-_680485.jpg

The magnificent interior and exterior of this building was used as a prototype for the Gringotts bank in Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone.

In 《Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone》:

00:23:48-00:25:07: The film follows the footsteps of Harry and Hagrid as they take Harry's gold coins and briefly introduce the inner and outer structure of Gringotts bank.

Address: Strand, London WC2B 4LA, UK
entry.summary: Australia House, is the diplomatic arm of Australia in the United Kingdom.

entry.title: Borough Market
entry.content:
Borough Market is London's famous food market [1].

In "Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban" [2]. In the film, the crazy Knight Bus took Harry from the park to the door of the Leaky Cauldron quickly.

Creator: Diliff
Licence: CC BY-SA 3.0
Source Link: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Borough_Market_cake_stall,_London,_England_-_Oct_2008.jpg

Borough Market is a food market with a lively atmosphere and has been around for over two hundred years. The market has many countries' delicious food, such as paella and Thai coconut cake. Borough Market is also near London Bridge and the Shard Building.

Address: 8 Southwark St, London SE1 1TL, UK
entry.summary: Borough Market is London's famous food market.

entry.title: Christian Church Canteen
entry.content:
Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry has a magnificent and solemn restaurant with a dome full of stars [1].

In this restaurant, the protagonists such as Harry, Ron, Hermione and others attend freshman entrance dinners, "sorting" ceremonies, Christmas dinners, student dances, etc. During meals on weekdays, they secretly discuss "special plans" to deal with their opponents. The prototype of this restaurant is the Oxford University Christian College Canteen, also known as the "Great Hall". The Harry Potter restaurant Oxford scenes were actually filmed at Leavesden Studios, where they rebuilt the hall, drawing inspiration from all the portraits and long tables.

Photographed by SunDan

Founded in 1525, Christian College is the largest college in Oxford University and the only church-style college in the world [2]. Its student cafeteria is an important part of the college. The cafeteria serves four meals a day, breakfast, lunch and two dinners. Among them, the dinner at 6 in the afternoon is informal, students and teachers can eat in casual clothes; the dinner at 8 in the evening is a formal dinner, and diners must wear formal attire.

The seats in the canteen are divided by level. For example, professors, senior researchers, and visiting researchers can sit at the "high table", while students can sit in ordinary seats. This classification began with the founder of the college. Because the founder was a bishop, the college was once called the "Bishop's College", so the religious hierarchy was maintained in many places.

British philosopher Locke, scientist Einstein, author of "Alice in Wonderland" Carol, and many British prime ministers and parliamentarians have all eaten in the cafeteria of Christian College [3].

Address: Oxford OX1 2JD, UK
entry.summary: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry has a magnificent and solemn restaurant with a dome full of stars.

entry.title: Great Scotland Yard
entry.content:
Great Scotland Yard is a street in Westminster, London [1].

Creator: R Sones
Lincence: CC BY-SA 2.0
Source Link: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Great_Scotland_Yard_SW1_-_geograph.org.uk_-_1623573.jpg

In "Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince" [2], when Harry and Mr. Weasley went to a hearing for using magic in front of Muggles, they entered the Ministry of Magic through a red telephone booth here. In "Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix" [3], Weasley also took Harry through here to enter the Ministry of Magic and attend disciplinary hearings.

The point of entry into the Ministry of Magic is at the junction of Scotland Square and Great Scotland Yard. Unfortunately, the red telephone booth is only a filming prop. If visitors come to sightseeing, they will not see the red telephone booth.

Address: St. James's, Westminster, London, UK
entry.summary: Great Scotland Yard is a street in Westminster, London.

entry.title: Hogwarts Stairs
entry.content:
The very well-known Harry Potter filming location is the stairwell leading to the hall [1].

These iconic Harry Potter scenes have been used in many movies, but they are best known for the grand arrival of the students on the first day of Hogwarts. In "Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone" [2], Professor McGonagall stands at the top of the stairs and taps his fingers, waiting for the new students to enter.

Photographed by SunDan

Before leading them into the huge hall, she briefly introduced them to the sorting ceremony. Including the scene where Harry Potter saw his father's trophy in the corridor.

This is also the staircase that Harry and Ron climbed up when they arrived at Hogwarts in Arthur Weasley's flying car in “Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets” [3]. They were rushing to attend the welcome banquet on time, but unfortunately, they were quickly caught by Mr. Filch.

Address: Harry Potter Studio Tour, Leavesden, Watford WD25 7LR, UK
entry.summary: The very well-known Harry Potter filming location is the stairwell leading to the hall.

entry.title: King’s Cross Station
entry.content:
King's Cross railway station, is a passenger railway terminus in the Camden, which is on the edge of Central London [1].

In the Harry Potter films, King's Cross Station appears in every one of them, with Platform 9 and 3/4 (entered through the brick wall barrier between platforms 9 and 10) being the wizards' entrance to Hogwarts.

Creators: George Rex
Licence: CC BY-SA 2.0
Source Link: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:King%27s_Cross_station,_August_2014.jpg

In 《Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone》:

00:33:02 - 00:36:01: The film is set in King's Cross station. This clip is about a funny incident that happened during Harry's first trip to Hogwarts.

00:33:31: Close-up of Platform 9 and 3/4 ticket

00:35:58: Close-up of Platform 9 and 3/4 stop sign

In fact, the real location for the filming was not between platforms 9 and 10. This is because platforms 9 and 10 are in a separate building from the main station and are separated by two intermediate tracks [2]. The real pick-up point is located between platforms 4 and 5 [3].

Creators: Cmglee
Licence: CC BY-SA 4.0
Source Link: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Cmglee_London_Kings_Cross_Platform_9_3_4.jpg

In 1999, a replica of the 9 and 3/4 station plaque was erected on the platform with the half-entered suitcase underneath, and in 2012, the Harry Potter shop was opened and the plaque was relocated, making it a popular attraction for fans and tourists alike.

Address: Euston Rd, Greater London N1 9AL, UK
entry.summary: King's Cross railway station, also known as London King's Cross.

entry.title: Lambeth Bridge
entry.content:
Lambeth Bridge spans the River Thames and connects Lambeth to Westminster [1].

In "Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban" [2], Harry ran away from his aunt's house and was homeless. At that time, he came across a knight bus. In the film, the Knight Bus and two Muggle buses faced each other on a bridge. When Harry screamed out of fear, the Knight Bus suddenly narrowed and then managed to pass through the two Muggle buses.

Creators: Justin Norris
Licence: CC BY 2.0
Source Link: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:River_Thames_and_Lambeth_Bridge-7July2007.jpg

The bridge in the film clip is Lambeth Bridge, which spans the River Thames and connects Lambeth to Westminster. Lambeth Bridge is adjacent to Westminster Bridge, which is located downstream of it. Lambeth Bridge is dominated by red, the same color as the leather benches in the House of Lords at the Palace of Westminster. Westminster Bridge, on the other hand, is predominantly green, the same color as the leather benches in the House of Commons at the Palace of Westminster. Standing on Lambeth Bridge, you can see the famous British attractions Big Ben and the London Eye.

Address: Lambeth Rd, London SE1 7SG, UK
entry.summary: Lambeth Bridge spans the River Thames and connects Lambeth to Westminster.

entry.title: Leadenhall Market
entry.content:
Leadenhall Market is a covered market in the historic center of the City of London financial district. It is an ancient market that can be dated from the 14th century[1].

Creators: Diliff
Licence: CC BY-SA 3.0
Source Link: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Leadenhall_Market_In_London_-_Feb_2006_rotated.jpg

Leadenhall Market is one of the main locations for Diagon Alley in the Harry Potter film series.

Creators: Diego Delso
Licence: CC BY-SA 4.0
Source Link: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Mercado_Leadenhall,_Londres,_Inglaterra,_2014-08-07,_DD_049.JPG

In 《Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone》:

00:20:30: Hagrid takes Harry past Leadenhall Market and from the Leaky Cauldron into Diagon Alley to buy Harry's school supplies: wands, owls, etc.

Address: Gracechurch St, London EC3V 1LT, UK
entry.summary: Leadenhall Market is a covered market in London, located on Gracechurch Street.

entry.title: London Zoo
entry.content:
London Zoo is the world's oldest scientific zoo. It was opened to the public in 1847 [1].

Creators: Chmee2
Licence: CC BY-SA 3.0
Source Link: https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:ZSL_London_Zoo_in_the_Regent%27s_Park_in_London,_June_2013.jpg

In 《Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone》:

00:05:58-00:08:10: Harry's aunt took them along to London Zoo for his son Dali's birthday and Harry had a conversation with a Burmese python in the Reptile House.

Actually, the tank pictured here is usually home to a small reptile. The plaque next to the fence commemorates the event.

00:06:55: Close up of the plaque

Address: London NW1 4RY, UK
entry.summary: London Zoo is the world's oldest scientific zoo. It was opened to the public in 1847.
